tit.cmt: データベースには sadako で登録があったのですが原文を優先して左記の通り訳出しました。

sen.j: 斉子内親王（ただこ（せいし）ないしんのう）は、平安時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Tadako (Seishi) was a member of the imperial family in the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Tadako (Seishi) was a member of the imperial family during the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Tadako (also known as Seishi) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: also known as 補足用語統一

sen.e: She was a princess of Emperor Saga (?-853).
She was the princess of Emperor Saga (?-853).
She was the princess of Emperor Saga (?-853).
Her mother was a court lady, FUNYA no Ayako.
Her mother was a court lady, FUNYA no Ayako.
Her mother was a court lady, FUNYA no Ayako.
She passed away on May 16, 853.
She passed away on May 16, 853.
She passed away on June 29, 853.
She was a princess of Emperor Daigo (921-936).
She was the princess of Emperor Daigo (921-936).
She was the princess of Emperor Daigo (921-936).
Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)), MINAMOTO no Kazuko.
Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court - a consort of an emperor), MINAMOTO no Kazuko.
Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court - a consort of an emperor), MINAMOTO no Kazuko.
She became a Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) in 936, but passed away in the same year.
She became Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) in 936, but passed away in the same year.
She became Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) in 936, but passed away in the same year.

sen.j: 小一条院敦明親王の王女。
sen.e: She was a princess of Koichijo-in, Imperial Prince Atsuakira.
She was the princess of Koichijo-in, Imperial Prince Atsuakira.
She was the princess of Koichijoin, Imperial Prince Atsuakira.
The details are described below.
The details are described below.
The details are described below.

sen.j: 斉子内親王（ただこ（せいし）ないしんのう、生没年不詳）は、斎院。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Tadako (Seishi) (date of birth and death was unknown) was a Sai-in (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
Imperial Princess Tadako (Seishi) (date of birth and death was unknown) was a Sai-in (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
Imperial Princess Tadako (also known as Seishi) (year of birth and death was unknown) was a Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
sen.cmt: also known as 補足用語統一

sen.j: 小一条院敦明親王の王女で、母は下野国守源政隆女（瑠璃女御）。
sen.e: She was a princess of Koichijo-in, Imperial Prince Atsuakira, and her mother was a daughter of Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) MINAMOTO no Masataka (.Lady Ruri).
She was a princess of Koichijo-in, Imperial Prince Atsuakira, and her mother was a daughter of Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) MINAMOTO no Masataka (.Lady Ruri).
She was a princess of Koichijoin, Imperial Prince Atsuakira, and her mother was a daughter of Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) MINAMOTO no Masataka (.Lady Ruri).

sen.j: 同母兄弟に源信宗らがいた。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Nobumune was one of her siblings with the same mother.
MINAMOTO no Nobumune was one of her siblings by the same mother.
MINAMOTO no Nobumune was one of her siblings by the same mother.

sen.j: 母方の出自の低さから、内親王ではなく「斉子女王」と表記することもある。
sen.e: She may be described as `princess Tadako' instead of imperial princess because her mother's origin was low.
She may be described as `princess Tadako' instead of imperial princess because her mother's origin was low.
She may be described as `princess Tadako' instead of imperial princess because her mother's origin was low.

sen.j: 承保元年（1074年）12月8日斎院に卜定され、白河天皇及び堀河天皇の斎院として16年間奉仕した。
sen.e: On December 8, 1074, she was designated as Sai-in (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling), and served as Sai-in of Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Horikawa for sixteen years.

On December 8, 1074, she was designated as Sai-in (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling), and served as Sai-in of Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Horikawa for sixteen years.

On January 3, 1075, she was designated as Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling), and served as Saiin of Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Horikawa for sixteen years.
sen.cmt: グレゴリ暦に用語統一

sen.j: 寛治3年（1089年）4月12日、母の喪により退下。
sen.e: On April 12, 1089, she resigned for mourning for her mother.
On April 12, 1089, she resigned to mourn for her mother.
On May 30, 1089, she resigned to mourn for her mother.
sen.cmt: グレゴリ暦に用語統一

sen.j: 以後の消息は不明である。
sen.e: Nothing was heard of her after that.
Nothing was heard of her after that.
Nothing was heard of her after that.
